meanings.definition: A lullaby or soothing song sung to children to help them fall asleep.
meanings.sent1: The mother sang a hushaby to her baby every night.
meanings.sent2: The hushaby filled the room with a peaceful melody.
meanings.sent3: The hushaby was so gentle that even the stars seemed to listen.
meanings.sent4: The hushaby wrapped the child in a blanket of sweet dreams.
meanings.sent5: The hushaby whispered secrets of sleep to the little one.

meanings.definition: To sing or speak softly in a soothing manner to calm or quiet someone.
meanings.sent1: She would hushaby her friend when they felt upset.
meanings.sent2: He hushabied the scared puppy until it relaxed.
meanings.sent3: The teacher hushabied the noisy classroom into silence.
meanings.sent4: His gentle voice hushabied the stormy sea into calmness.
meanings.sent5: The soothing sound of the river hushabied the worried mind.

meanings.definition: A word used to command silence or quiet.
meanings.sent1: The librarian used a hushaby to quiet the noisy readers.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's hushaby hushed the chattering students.
meanings.sent3: The hushaby of the wind through the trees calmed the forest.
meanings.sent4: The gentle hushaby of the rain lulled the city to sleep.
meanings.sent5: The hushaby of the falling snow blanketed the world in peace.
